snippet: Operating on the brain is usually seen as a last resort when drugs fail, but a new study suggests that having surgery sooner may prevent irreversible damage.
abstract: Dr Jerome Engel Jr study in The Journal of the American Medical Association suggests that epilepsy patients should undergo surgery as soon as possible after the failure of anti-epilepsy drugs, rather than pursuing continued medical care.
lead_paragraph: Operating on the brain is usually seen as a last resort when drugs fail, but a new study suggests that having surgery sooner may prevent irreversible damage.
